hook.text: Egypt's revolution overthrew Mubarak. Two years later, a military coup restored authoritarian rule. Full circle.

buildup.text: Counterrevolution happens when forces of the old regime regroup and reverse revolutionary gains.

discovery.text: The old elite often controls the military, judiciary, and economy. They have tools to undermine new governments.

twist.text: Some counterrevolutions use democratic tools. Hungary's OrbÃ¡n was elected, then dismantled democratic institutions.

climax.text: Preventing counterrevolution requires reforming institutions, not just removing leaders. Systems outlast individuals.

punchline.text: Revolutions change leaders. Counterrevolutions show the system didn't change.

quiz.question: What happened in Egypt after the 2011 revolution?
options: A military coup in 2013 restored authoritarian rule
Democracy flourished and strengthened over time
